meanings.definition: To surpass in generalship or strategy.
meanings.sent1: In the game of chess, the grandmaster was able to outgeneral his opponent with clever moves.
meanings.sent2: The military commander was able to outgeneral the enemy forces and secure victory.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fox was able to outgeneral the hunter by leading him on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: She always manages to outgeneral her competitors in business, staying one step ahead.
meanings.sent5: The detective was able to outgeneral the criminal by anticipating his every move.

meanings.definition: To outwit or outmaneuver in a strategic or tactical situation.
meanings.sent1: The spy was able to outgeneral the enemy agents by using clever disguises.
meanings.sent2: The team was able to outgeneral their opponents by executing a surprise attack.
meanings.sent3: The clever raccoon managed to outgeneral the campers and steal their food.
meanings.sent4: She always finds a way to outgeneral her opponents in debates, making her arguments stronger.
meanings.sent5: The young inventor was able to outgeneral the older competitors with his innovative ideas.
